etymologies: late Middle English (denoting a piece of felt): from French filtre, from medieval Latin filtrum ‘felt used as a filter’, of West Germanic origin and related to felt

definitions: a porous device for removing impurities or solid particles from a liquid or gas passed through it
shortDefinitions: porous device removing impurities etc. from liquid or gas

definitions: a screen, plate, or layer of a substance which absorbs light or other radiation or selectively absorbs some of its components

examples.text: filters can be used in photography to reduce haze

shortDefinitions: device or substance absorbing light or other radiation

definitions: a device for suppressing electrical or sound waves of frequencies not required.
shortDefinitions: device for suppressing certain electrical or sound waves

definitions: (in image-editing software) a function used to alter the overall appearance of an image in a specific manner

examples.text: many other apps also offer filters for enhancing photos

shortDefinitions: software function used to alter appearance of digital image

definitions: a piece of software that processes text, for example to remove unwanted spaces or to format it for use in another application.
shortDefinitions: piece of software that processes text

definitions: an arrangement whereby vehicles may turn left (or right) while other traffic waiting to go straight ahead or turn right (or left) is stopped by a red light
shortDefinitions: arrangement allowing certain vehicles to proceed while others must wait

definitions: pass (a liquid, gas, light, or sound) through a device to remove unwanted material

examples.text: the patient is hooked up to a dialysis machine twice a week to filter out the cholesterol in the blood

definitions: process or assess (items) in order to reject those that are unwanted

examples.text: you'll be put through to a secretary whose job it is to filter calls
the brain has the ability to filter out information it considers non-essential

definitions: process or treat with a filter.
move slowly or in small quantities or numbers through something or in a specified direction

examples.text: people filtered out of the concert during the last set

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: enter slowly or in small quantities

examples.text: the news began to filter in from the hospital
